html: #SurpriseBilling can deter patients from seeking needed medical care. Forty-five percent of people report they have delayed or avoided seeking care due to high out-of-pocket costs.pic.twitter.com/qjLTuPOOXD

html: If you are hit by #SurpriseBilling, call your insurance company and ask to negotiate your bill or file a complaint with your state insurance commissioner or attorney general, or the Better Business Bureau.pic.twitter.com/bdr7k3dDmx
text: If you are hit by #SurpriseBilling, call your insurance company and ask to negotiate your bill or file a complaint with your state insurance commissioner or attorney general, or the Better Business Bureau.pic.twitter.com/bdr7k3dDmx

html: Millions of Americans have been victimized by surprise medical billing and often have few or no options to negotiate what they must pay. #ProtectPatients #EndSurpriseMedicalBillingpic.twitter.com/LpOTNRFnIh
text: Millions of Americans have been victimized by surprise medical billing and often have few or no options to negotiate what they must pay. #ProtectPatients #EndSurpriseMedicalBillingpic.twitter.com/LpOTNRFnIh

html: Avoid #SurpriseBilling in non-emergency situations by asking your insurer which ambulance companies are in-network and the cost of in-network and out-of-network ambulance rides. #EndSurpriseMedicalBillingpic.twitter.com/7mI2OdMHTO
text: Avoid #SurpriseBilling in non-emergency situations by asking your insurer which ambulance companies are in-network and the cost of in-network and out-of-network ambulance rides. #EndSurpriseMedicalBillingpic.twitter.com/7mI2OdMHTO

html: When we put money in the pockets of hardworking Americans, they spend that money in the local economy. That’s one reason I’m proud to support the #RaiseTheWage Act. This bill is good for workers, good for businesses, and good for the economy.pic.twitter.com/1WrgWPuHnL
text: When we put money in the pockets of hardworking Americans, they spend that money in the local economy. That’s one reason I’m proud to support the #RaiseTheWage Act. This bill is good for workers, good for businesses, and good for the economy.pic.twitter.com/1WrgWPuHnL

html: By 2024, $15 an hour is the least a person would need to afford the basic essentials in any place in America; including rural and southern parts of the country. html: I am extremely pleased that @amazon is expanding its operations in Florida by launching cargo flights out of @iflymia. This good news follows the announcement that the corporation is raising its minimum hourly wage to $15. Welcome to Miami, Amazon Air!https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/mia-welcomes-amazon-air-as-company-continues-to-expand-300729134.html …

html: Excited to welcome Taranique and her mother to Miami, where she’ll finally receive the care she deserves. Taranique is a stateless teen in need of treatment at ⁦@JacksonHealth⁩.
